content.description:
Classic climbing with a less-than-classic approach.  When I did it, we climbed up through the bushes and munge to get to the base of the crack.  I can't say I recommend this option and encourage others to rap in from the top to the base of the clean rock.   

  From this point Zion Train provides steep, engaging movement on perfect cracks and beautiful rock.
Another moderate classic.  Lost Art's easier little brother.   A 60m will barely reach the ledge just above the ground.  (but it's workable)  A 70 is a better option.
This route begins on Pedestal and then hand traverses left on a beautiful flake to access the hanging dihedral to the left.  It's a little punchy once you start up the corner.
content.protection: Gear to 3.5".  Some thin gear will be useful.

content.description: Thin finger crack to start with some ledges on either side, widening as you go. A gully then leads to a squeeze chimney to finish.
content.protection: Gear to 5" and Big Bro for top-out. Small trees for anchor.
content.location: Same start as Bitch I Won, which takes off to the right.

content.description: This route is the large hanging flake 2-3 routes to the right of Zion Train.  Start in a mungy corner with moderate stemming under the left side of the flake.  From there, traverse right and tackle the pumpy and physical flake.
This fine route starts on Lost Art, but veers right after 10' and follows ledges to the obvious splitter dihedral. Up this to the top. A fun mix of techy and burly.
content.protection: Thin through 3". A 70m rope is best for the rap.

content.description: One of the most classic lines at the crag and one of the better hand cracks in the state.  It's steeper and longer than it looks from the ground.  A 60m will barely reach the ledge just above the ground.  (but it's workable)  A 70 is a better option.

This is the zone right where the approach trail meets the cliff.  The trail spits you out almost directly under Lost Art/Up on a Pedestal.  The cliff is 30-35m tall on this end and, as a result, is shaded by trees pretty much all day.
